name: Breath of Fury
text:
Enchant creature you control
When enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, sacrifice it and attach Breath of Fury to a creature you control. If you do, untap all creatures you control and after this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

name: Breath of Life
text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

editions.flavor:
"Nothing can stop the power of life—not even death."
—Onean cleric

"Nothing can stop the power of life—not even death."
—Onean cleric

name: Breath of Malfegor
text: Breath of Malfegor deals 5 damage to each opponent.

editions.flavor: The blood of the demons quickened as their master rose over the battlefield. The blood of the angels also quickened: here was the chance to finally end the war started millennia ago.
The draconic demon loomed over Dack, and he suddenly sensed he wasn't the only Planeswalker that Malfegor had encountered.

name: Breathstealer
text: {B}: Breathstealer gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"As a child, I slept with a cloth over my face, to hide from the spirits that might pull the air from my lungs."
—Mosi, Femeref weaver

name: Breathstealer's Crypt
text: If a player would draw a card, instead he or she draws a card and reveals it. If it's a creature card, that player discards it unless he or she pays 3 life.

editions.flavor:
"Far too many soldiers have died in their beds."
—Telim'Tor

name: Bred for the Hunt
text: Whenever a creature you control with a +1/+1 counter on it deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.

editions.flavor: Some see the world as a place of infinite wonder and knowledge. Some see it as an infinite dinner plate.
Some see the world as a place of infinite wonder and knowledge. Some see it as an infinite dinner plate.

name: Breeding Pit
text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Breeding Pit unless you pay {B}{B}.
At the beginning of your end step, create a 0/1 black Thrull creature token.

editions.flavor: The thrulls bred at a terrifying pace. In the end, they overwhelmed the Order of the Ebon Hand.
The thrulls bred at a terrifying pace. In the end, they overwhelmed the Order of the Ebon Hand.
The Thrulls bred at a terrifying pace. In the end, they overwhelmed the Order of the Ebon Hand.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Divine vs. Demonic
editions.flavor: The thrulls bred at a terrifying pace. In the end, they overwhelmed the Order of the Ebon Hand.

name: Breeding Pool
text:
({T}: Add {G} or {U} to your mana pool.)
As Breeding Pool enters the battlefield, you may pay 2 life. If you don't, Breeding Pool enters the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: Uncharted depths. Unbounded hopes. Unfathomable mysteries.

name: Breezekeeper
text:
Flying
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)

editions.flavor:
"He blows a gust across the cliff to vanish in a breath of wind."
—"Song of the Wind Being"

name: Breya, Etherium Shaper
text:
When Breya, Etherium Shaper enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 blue Thopter artifact creature tokens with flying.
{2}, Sacrifice two artifacts: Choose one —
• Breya deals 3 damage to target player.
• Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
• You gain 5 life.

name: Briarberry Cohort
text:
Flying
Briarberry Cohort gets +1/+1 as long as you control another blue creature.

editions.flavor: A clique can cause far more mischief than one faerie on its own.

name: Briarbridge Patrol
text:
Whenever Briarbridge Patrol deals damage to one or more creatures, investigate. (Create a colorless Clue artifact token with "{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.")
At the beginning of each end step, if you sacrificed three or more Clues this turn, you may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

name: Briarhorn
text:
Flash
When Briarhorn enters the battlefield, target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Evoke {1}{G} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

Duel Decks: Nissa vs. Ob Nixilis

name: Briarknit Kami
text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

editions.flavor: One thorn to warn, ten thorns to defend, a hundred thorns to destroy.

name: Briarpack Alpha
text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Briarpack Alpha enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"The wolves turned on us and a chill swept over me. The pack had a new leader."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

"One of my greatest teachers."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

name: Briar Patch
text: Whenever a creature attacks you, it gets -1/-0 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: As easily as the dryads could close a fist, so could the branches and underbrush entangle.

name: Briar Shield
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
Sacrifice Briar Shield: Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: In all its forms, the forest is the elves' best protector.

name: Briber's Purse
text:
Briber's Purse enters the battlefield with X gem counters on it.
{1}, {T}, Remove a gem counter from Briber's Purse: Target creature can't attack or block this turn.

editions.flavor: The bigger the hand, the higher the price.
Victory is certain. The price, negotiable.

name: Bribery
text: Search target opponent's library for a creature card and put that card onto the battlefield under your control. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

editions.flavor: In Mercadia City, loyalties extend only as far as your purse can stretch.
In Mercadia City, loyalties extend only as far as your purse can stretch.

name: Bridge from Below
text:
Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, if Bridge from Below is in your graveyard, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
When a creature is put into an opponent's graveyard from the battlefield, if Bridge from Below is in your graveyard, exile Bridge from Below.

name: Brightflame
text: Radiance — Brightflame deals X damage to target creature and each other creature that shares a color with it. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

editions.flavor:
"Let the pyres of the unbelievers light our way."
—Razia

name: Brighthearth Banneret
text:
Elemental spells and Warrior spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Reinforce 1—{1}{R} ({1}{R}, Discard this card: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.)

editions.flavor: The banner symbolizes the goodwill of the Brighthearth. Their emissaries bring the mastery of fire to other races.

name: Brightstone Ritual
text: Add {R} to your mana pool for each Goblin on the battlefield.

editions.flavor: Wizards fought over the stone to exploit its power. Goblins fight over it because it's shiny.

name: Brigid, Hero of Kinsbaile
text:
First strike
{T}: Brigid, Hero of Kinsbaile deals 2 damage to each attacking or blocking creature target player controls.

editions.flavor: Thanks to one champion archer, the true borders of Kinsbaile extend an arrow's flight beyond the buildings.

name: Brilliant Halo
text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.
When Brilliant Halo is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Brilliant Halo to its owner's hand.

name: Brilliant Plan
text: Draw three cards.

editions.flavor: At Red Cliffs, Kongming and Zhou Yu each wrote his plan for defeating the Wei on the palm of his hand. They laughed as they both revealed the same word, "Fire."
At Red Cliffs, Kongming and Zhou Yu each wrote his plan for defeating Wei on the palm of his hand. They laughed as they both revealed the same word, "Fire."
At Red Cliffs, Kongming and Zhou Yu each wrote his plan for defeating Wei on the palm of his hand. They laughed as they both revealed the same word, "Fire."

name: Brilliant Spectrum
text: Converge — Draw X cards, where X is the number of colors of mana spent to cast Brilliant Spectrum. Then discard two cards.

editions.flavor: There are more sights on Zendikar than the eyes can see.

name: Brilliant Ultimatum
text: Exile the top five cards of your library. An opponent separates those cards into two piles. You may play any number of cards from one of those piles without paying their mana costs.

editions.flavor: Revealing the truth only deepened Tezzeret's curiosity for the secrets still buried.

name: Brimaz, King of Oreskos
text:
Vigilance
Whenever Brimaz, King of Oreskos attacks, create a 1/1 white Cat Soldier creature token with vigilance that's attacking.
Whenever Brimaz blocks a creature, create a 1/1 white Cat Soldier creature token with vigilance that's blocking that creature.

name: Brimstone Dragon
text: Flying, haste

name: Brimstone Volley
text:
Brimstone Volley deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

name: Brindle Boar
text: Sacrifice Brindle Boar: You gain 4 life.

editions.flavor: The war lasted for generations. The boars didn't need to hunt for food anymore. They fed on the fallen corpses, and the living fed off of them.

"Tell the cooks to prepare the fires. Tonight we feast!"
—Tolar Wolfbrother, Krosan tracker

"Tell the cooks to prepare the fires. Tonight we feast!"
—Tolar Wolfbrother, Krosan tracker

name: Brindle Shoat
text: When Brindle Shoat dies, create a 3/3 green Boar creature token.

editions.flavor: Hunters lure the stripling boar into the open, hoping to trap greater prey.

name: Brine Elemental
text:

When Brine Elemental is turned face up, each opponent skips his or her next untap step.

text:

text: Bring Low deals 3 damage to target creature. If that creature has a +1/+1 counter on it, Bring Low deals 5 damage to it instead.

editions.flavor:
"People are often humbled by the elements. But the elements, too, can be humbled."
—Surrak, khan of the Temur

name: Bring to Light
text: Converge — Search your library for a creature, instant, or sorcery card with converted mana cost less than or equal to the number of colors of mana spent to cast Bring to Light, exile that card, then shuffle your library. You may cast that card without paying its mana cost.

name: Brink of Disaster
text:
Enchant creature or land
When enchanted permanent becomes tapped, destroy it.

editions.flavor:
"You always have a choice. That doesn't mean you always have a good choice."
—Alubri, Guul Draz gatekeeper

"When you find yourself teetering on the edge of oblivion, mine will be the hands taking pleasure in giving you the final push."
—Liliana Vess

name: Brink of Madness
text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have no cards in hand, sacrifice Brink of Madness and target opponent discards his or her hand.

editions.flavor:
"The fools thought me dead. But I built an empire inside my tomb."
—Kerrick, sleeper agent

name: Brion Stoutarm
text:
Lifelink
{R}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature other than Brion Stoutarm: Brion Stoutarm deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target player.

text:
Flying, first strike, vigilance, lifelink

editions.flavor: Upon discovering what had become of her sisters, Sigarda could only weep.

name: Broken Ambitions
text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. Clash with an opponent. If you win, that spell's controller puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

name: Broken Concentration
text:
Counter target spell.
Madness {3}{U} (If you discard this card, discard it into exile. When you do, cast it for its madness cost or put it into your graveyard.)

editions.flavor: Some minds bend under pressure. Others break.

name: Broken Dam
text: Tap one or two target creatures without horsemanship.

editions.flavor: Using nature to their advantage, wise Three Kingdoms generals often let dammed rivers loose to destroy their enemies.

name: Broken Fall
text: Return Broken Fall to its owner's hand: Regenerate target creature.

text: Destroy target nonartifact attacking creature. It can't be regenerated. Create a black Spirit creature token. Its power is equal to that creature's power and its toughness is equal to that creature's toughness. Sacrifice the token at the beginning of the next end step.

Provoke (Whenever this creature attacks, you may have target creature defending player controls untap and block it if able.)

editions.flavor: Lucky victims get run over. Unlucky victims get run through.

text:

If you speak in your normal voice, sacrifice Bronze Calendar.

editions.flavor: Every page holds a month, every date a numeral.

text:
Trample
As long as you control another creature, prevent all damage that would be dealt to Bronze Horse by spells that target it.

text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: Blood, bone, and sinew are magnified, as is the rage that drives them. The brain, however, remains unchanged—a little bean, swinging by a strand in a cavernous, raving head.

name: Brute Strength
text: Target creature gets +3/+1 and gains trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Oketra had our crop build an obelisk to prove the power of working together. But I am stronger without the weak."
It's not the size of the rock. It's how badly you want to lift it.

name: Bubble Matrix
text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to creatures.

editions.flavor:
"This device was commisioned by a king who desired peace. Unfortunately, the royal artificer was also the king's jester."
—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

name: Bubbling Beebles
text: Bubbling Beebles can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an enchantment.

editions.flavor:
"Chancellor Rayne canceled the annual beeble roast. I should have married a crueler woman."
—Barrin

name: Bubbling Cauldron
text:
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 4 life.
{1}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature named Festering Newt: Each opponent loses 4 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.
